NODE 03A // ENTRY

Current Mirror Mismatch Notes from Monte Carlo Runs

[2026.01.28]

Mismatch analysis gets useful only when the setup is consistent. I now save one template testbench per topology and vary only geometry and bias points between runs.

What changed my results

  • I stopped comparing absolute currents first and started comparing percent error distributions.
  • I tracked temperature corners alongside process corners in a single summary.
  • I annotated each run with layout intent (common centroid, interdigitation, shared guard ring).

Measurement snapshot

Mirror Type: PMOS cascode
Target Current: 100 uA
PVT: TT, 1.2 V, 27 C
Monte Carlo Samples: 500
Mean Error: 0.84%
3-sigma Error: 3.27%

The next step is correlating these mismatch statistics with extracted layout parasitics to separate device mismatch effects from routing imbalance.
